PETERSBURG — A 12-year-old boy was arrested Monday afternoon after St. Petersburg police said he stole a car from an 89-year-old man last week — and officers said this was not the boy's first alleged vehicle theft. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Raymond Raftery of Gulfport was pumping gas at 3890 22nd Ave. S on Friday morning when police said the boy, on a bicycle, told Raftery that one of his tires was low on air. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR When Raftery got out to check his Toyota, police said, the boy made his move. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "He jumped off the bike and into the car and was gone in 30 seconds," Raftery said Tuesday morning. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "He was good," Raftery said. "I felt kind of dumb afterward, but it was broad daylight, and he was a kid. If it was an adult, I would have been more suspicious, but you never know — you live and you learn." NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The boy was spotted by detectives Monday. He was arrested on a charge of grand theft motor vehicle. Authorities said the boy, who was not identified because of his age, has been arrested more than 20 times. Raftery wasn't injured and said
